00015 #define           SHADE_TABLE_DIR                     "ShadeTables"

00019 extern CHAR8 TileSurfaceFilenames[NUMBEROFTILETYPES][32]; // symbol already declared globally in worlddef.cpp (jonathanl)
00020 BOOLEAN gfForceBuildShadeTables = FALSE;

00022 #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00023       extern UINT32 uiNumTablesSaved;
00024       extern UINT32 uiNumTablesLoaded;
00025 #endif
00026 
00027 void DetermineRGBDistributionSettings()
00028 {
00029       STRING512               DataDir;
00030       STRING512               ExecDir;
00031       STRING512               ShadeTableDir;
00032       UINT32                        uiRBitMask, uiGBitMask, uiBBitMask;
00033       UINT32                        uiPrevRBitMask, uiPrevGBitMask, uiPrevBBitMask;
00034       UINT32                        uiNumBytesRead;
00035       HWFILE                        hfile;
00036       BOOLEAN                       fSaveRGBDist = FALSE;
00037       BOOLEAN                       fCleanShadeTable = FALSE;
00038       BOOLEAN                       fLoadedPrevRGBDist = FALSE;
00039 
00040       // Snap: save current directory
00041       GetFileManCurrentDirectory( DataDir );
00042 
00043       //First, determine if we have a file saved.  If not, then this is the first time, and
00044       //all shade tables will have to be built and saved to disk.  This can be time consuming, adding up to
00045       //3-4 seconds to the time of a map load.
00046       GetExecutableDirectory( ExecDir );
00047       sprintf( ShadeTableDir, "%s\\%s", DataDir, SHADE_TABLE_DIR );
00048 
00049       
00050       //Check to make sure we have a ShadeTable directory.  If we don't create one!
00051       if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( ShadeTableDir ) )
00052       {
00053             if( !MakeFileManDirectory( ShadeTableDir ) )
00054             {
00055                   AssertMsg( 0, "ShadeTable directory doesn't exist, and couldn't create one!" );
00056             }
00057             if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( ShadeTableDir ) )
00058             {
00059                   AssertMsg( 0, "Couldn't access the newly created ShadeTable directory." );
00060             }
00061             fSaveRGBDist = TRUE;
00062       }
00063       
00064       if( !fSaveRGBDist )
00065       { //Load the previous RGBDist and determine if it is the same one
00066             if( !FileExists( "RGBDist.dat" ) || FileExists( "ResetShadeTables.txt" ) )
00067             { //Can't find the RGBDist.dat file.  The directory exists, but the file doesn't, which
00068                   //means the user deleted the file manually.  Now, set it up to create a new one.
00069                   fSaveRGBDist = TRUE;
00070                   fCleanShadeTable = TRUE;
00071             }
00072             else
00073             {
00074                   hfile = FileOpen( "RGBDist.dat", FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE );
00075                   if( !hfile )
00076                   {
00077                         AssertMsg( 0, "Couldn't open RGBDist.dat, even though it exists!" );
00078                   }
00079                   FileRead( hfile, &uiPrevRBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00080                   FileRead( hfile, &uiPrevGBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00081                   FileRead( hfile, &uiPrevBBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00082                   fLoadedPrevRGBDist = TRUE;
00083                   FileClose( hfile );
00084             }
00085       }
00086 
00087       if( !GetPrimaryRGBDistributionMasks( &uiRBitMask, &uiGBitMask, &uiBBitMask ) )
00088       {
00089             AssertMsg( 0, "Failed to extract the current RGB distribution masks." );
00090       }
00091       if( fLoadedPrevRGBDist )
00092       {
00093             if( uiRBitMask != uiPrevRBitMask || uiGBitMask != uiPrevGBitMask || uiBBitMask != uiPrevBBitMask )
00094             { //The user has changed modes since the last time he has played JA2.  This essentially can only happen if:
00095                   //1)  The video card has been changed since the last run of JA2.
00096                   //2)  Certain video cards have different RGB distributions in different operating systems such as
00097                   //          the Millenium card using Windows NT or Windows 95
00098                   //3)  The user has physically modified the RGBDist.dat file.
00099                   fSaveRGBDist = TRUE;
00100                   fCleanShadeTable = TRUE;
00101             }
00102       }
00103       if( fCleanShadeTable )
00104       { //This means that we are going to remove all of the current shade tables, if any exist, and
00105             //start fresh.  
00106             EraseDirectory( ShadeTableDir );
00107       }
00108       if( fSaveRGBDist )
00109       { //The RGB distribution is going to be saved in a tiny file for future reference.  As long as the
00110             //RGB distribution never changes, the shade table will grow until eventually, all tilesets are loaded,
00111             //shadetables generated and saved in this directory.  
00112             hfile = FileOpen( "RGBDist.dat", FILE_ACCESS_WRITE | FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS, FALSE );
00113             if( !hfile )
00114             {
00115                   AssertMsg( 0, "Couldn't create RGBDist.dat for writing!" );
00116             }
00117             FileWrite( hfile, &uiRBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00118             FileWrite( hfile, &uiGBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00119             FileWrite( hfile, &uiBBitMask, sizeof( UINT32 ), &uiNumBytesRead );
00120             FileClose( hfile );
00121       }
00122 
00123       // Snap: Restore the data directory once we are finished.
00124       SetFileManCurrentDirectory( DataDir );
00125       //We're done, so restore the executable directory to JA2\Data.
00126       //sprintf( DataDir, "%s\\Data", ExecDir );
00127       //SetFileManCurrentDirectory( DataDir );
00128 }
00129 
00130 BOOLEAN LoadShadeTable( HVOBJECT pObj, UINT32 uiTileTypeIndex )
00131 {
00132       HWFILE hfile;
00133       INT32 i;
00134       UINT32 uiNumBytesRead;
00135       UINT8 ShadeFileName[ 100 ];
00136       UINT8 *ptr;
00137       //ASSUMPTIONS:
00138       //We are assuming that the uiTileTypeIndex is referring to the correct file
00139       //stored in the TileSurfaceFilenames[].  If it isn't, then that is a huge problem
00140       //and should be fixed.  Also assumes that the directory is set to Data\ShadeTables.
00141       strcpy( ShadeFileName, TileSurfaceFilenames[ uiTileTypeIndex ] );
00142       ptr = (UINT8 *)strstr( ShadeFileName, "." );
00143       if( !ptr )
00144       {
00145             return FALSE;
00146       }
00147       ptr++;
00148       sprintf( (char *)ptr, "sha" );
00149 
00150       hfile = FileOpen( (STR)ShadeFileName, FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE );
00151       if( !hfile )
00152       { //File doesn't exist, so generate it
00153             FileClose( hfile );
00154             return FALSE;
00155       }
00156 
00157       //MISSING:  Compare time stamps.
00158 
00159       for( i = 0; i < 16; i++ )
00160       {
00161             pObj->pShades[ i ] = (UINT16 *) MemAlloc( 512 );
00162             Assert( pObj->pShades[ i ] );
00163             FileRead( hfile, pObj->pShades[ i ], 512, &uiNumBytesRead );
00164       }
00165 
00166       //The file exists, now make sure the 
00167       FileClose( hfile );
00168       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00169             uiNumTablesLoaded++;
00170       #endif
00171       return TRUE;
00172 }
00173 
00174 BOOLEAN SaveShadeTable( HVOBJECT pObj, UINT32 uiTileTypeIndex )
00175 {
00176       HWFILE hfile;
00177       INT32 i;
00178       UINT32 uiNumBytesWritten;
00179       UINT8 ShadeFileName[ 100 ];
00180       UINT8 *ptr;
00181       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00182             uiNumTablesSaved++;
00183       #endif
00184       //ASSUMPTIONS:
00185       //We are assuming that the uiTileTypeIndex is referring to the correct file
00186       //stored in the TileSurfaceFilenames[].  If it isn't, then that is a huge problem
00187       //and should be fixed.  Also assumes that the directory is set to Data\ShadeTables.
00188       strcpy( ShadeFileName, TileSurfaceFilenames[ uiTileTypeIndex ] );
00189       ptr = (UINT8 *)strstr( ShadeFileName, "." );
00190       if( !ptr )
00191       {
00192             return FALSE;
00193       }
00194       ptr++;
00195       sprintf( (char *) ptr, "sha" );
00196 
00197       hfile = FileOpen( (STR)ShadeFileName, FILE_ACCESS_WRITE | FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS, FALSE );
00198       if( !hfile )
00199       { 
00200             FileClose( hfile );
00201             AssertMsg( 0, String( "Can't create %s", ShadeFileName ) );
00202             return FALSE;
00203       }
00204       for( i = 0; i < 16; i++ )
00205       {
00206             FileWrite( hfile, pObj->pShades[ i ], 512, &uiNumBytesWritten );
00207       }
00208 
00209       FileClose( hfile );
00210       return TRUE;
00211 }

00215 BOOLEAN DeleteShadeTableDir( )
00216 {     
00217       return( RemoveFileManDirectory( SHADE_TABLE_DIR, TRUE ) );
00218 }
